PARAGRAPH.STRING: (Serbian and Macedonian: Шар Планина, Šar Planina ; Albanian: Malet e Sharrit, Mali i Sharrit, Sharr) is a mountain located on the southern border of Kosovo, Serbia and the northwest part of the Republic of Macedonia.

is around 80 kilometers long, some 10-20 kilometers wide. There are several high peaks:* Titov Vrv (2747 m), the highest peak* Turcin (2702 m)* Borislavec (2662 m)* Rudoka (2610 m)* Ljuboten (2498 m)* Piribeg
extends to Mount Korab (2764 m) in the southwest, and
includes crops up to around 1000 meters, forests up to 1700 meters, and above that lie high pastures which encompass around 550 square kilometers.
is the largest compact area covered with pastures on the European continent.
is most known as the origin of the dog breed Šarplaninac (Macedonian: Šarplaninec, Albanian: Qeni i Sharrit) which was bred on these pastures.
The Šar National Park is in the territory of the Autonomous Province of Kosovo and it spreads on 380 square kilometres, on the northern slopes of

. What this national park boasts in particular are the endemic relict Macedonian Pine and white-bark pine, as well as the Alpine rose. As for game, this is the habitat of the lynx, bear, chamois, wolf, roe deer, wild boar and other species.

The Šar National Park abounds in streams and small rivers and it spreads in the municipalities of Štrpce, Suva Reka, Kaāanik and Prizren (in Republic of Serbia, Kosovo province) and Jegunovce, Tearce, Dzepciste, Tetovo and Gostivar (in the Republic of Macedonia).
